title: Most polar molecule given Lewis structure

content.question: Which of the following Lewis electron-dot diagrams represents the molecule that is the most polar?

choices.label: A C I atom is connected with a single bond to an F atom. Each atom has 3 pairs of nonbonding electrons.
A B r atom is connected with a single bond to an F atom. Each atom has 3 pairs of nonbonding electrons.
An S atom is connected with a double bond to a C atom, which is connected with a double bond to another S atom. The S atoms each have 2 pairs of nonbonding electrons.
A B atom is connected with single bonds to 3 F atoms. Each F atom has 3 pairs of nonbonding electrons.

content.answer: A B r atom is connected with a single bond to an F atom. Each atom has 3 pairs of nonbonding electrons.

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
